content: grandma rita s nylon scrubbers my grandmother has been knitting these scrubbers for as long as i can remember all our family members and friends love them and request new ones all the time theyʼre great for scrubbing pots and pans or for cleaning sinks bathtubs etc theyʼre also super fast to crochet and make great gifts materials 72 wide nylon net the type used for crinolines -- the scratchier the better size j or k hook if you crochet at all tightly use k preparation using scissors or a rotary cutter cut the net into 2 wide 72 long strips tie 6 strips together using a square knot do not trim the ends these will act as stuffing inside your scrubber be careful not to pull the knot too tight or the netting will rip instructions chain 4 stitches connect in a circle using a slip_stitch note as you come to knots in your netting strip hold the knot to the outside of the scrubber you will tuck these ends in later put 2 single crochets in each of the 4 stitches in the chain continue with 2 single crochets in each stitch working your way around & around until you reach the 2nd knot in your strip of netting once you reach the 2nd knot do 1 single_crochet in each stitch until you reach the 4th knot in the strip single_crochet 3 more stitches one single_crochet in each stitch begin making a single_crochet in every other stitch before the opening becomes too small turn the entire scrubber inside out tuck all of the knotted ends inside to create fluff to fill the scrubber when you reach the last stitch pull end of the net through the stitch on the hook and tuck the end through the hole into the center of the scrubber © 2008 mandi coughlin www mandiknits com mandiknits@gmail com
